name: Asian-Inspired Sloppy Joes
author: LauraF
summary: Serve on white or whole-wheat buns with wasabi slaw and pickles. I make them on the drier side so they are not impossible to eat - tweak the recipe to make them as 'sloppy' as you like!
ingredients: 1 (1 inch) piece minced fresh ginger root
1 stalk lemongrass, tough outer stalks removed, inner stalks thinly sliced
salt and ground black pepper to taste
2 tablespoons wasabi-flavored mayonnaise (such as Trader Joe's®)
directions: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Add pork; cook and stir until pork is no longer pink, about 5 to 7 minutes
Add scallions, ginger, lemongrass, and garlic powder; cook and stir until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes
Stir in soy sauce and ketchup
Cook until flavors combine and mixture thickens slightly, 3 to 5 minutes
Combine cabbage, wasabi mayonnaise, rice vinegar, and lime juice in a large bowl; toss to mix slaw
Split each bread roll and fill with pork mixture
